title: ScamViruS
author: ScamViruS
content: What happened: Fake Gambling Website. Â Website: Code:https://ca777ino.uk/Someone suddenly contacted me on telegram, during a friendly discussion, he mentioned this gambling website and I know their tricks about such scams long before. Not all crypto users are aware of such scams, which is why scammers are still using this technique to achieve their goals.QuoteDomain:ca777ino.ukRegistrar:Namecheap, Inc. [Tag = NAMECHEAP-INC]Registered On:2022-10-27Expires On:2023-10-27Updated On:2022-10-27Status:Registered until expiry date.Name Servers:alexis.ns.cloudflare.comblakely.ns.cloudflare.comHis explanationQuoteok, I'll explain in brief, I found a vulnerability in the code on which this site is written, with which I can make any player a winner, I propose to make you a winner and divide the profit in half, https://ca777ino.uk/ go to the site and choose any player who is now betting, write me his nickname and I will make him the winner, thereby proving my veracity.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: ScamViruS on November 17, 2022, 07:53:58 PMHis explanationQuoteok, I'll explain in brief, I found a vulnerability in the code on which this site is written, with which I can make any player a winner, I propose to make you a winner and divide the profit in half, https://ca777ino.uk/ go to the site and choose any player who is now betting, write me his nickname and I will make him the winner, thereby proving my veracity.Hahaha, what a lame explanation from him. If the gambling platform for legit, He would write to them about the exploit in exchange for a bounty. Also given the greedy nature of most human being, I doubt if he would share the exploit with any random stranger online

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: It's been a while since I last saw this specific type of scam and the thing that separates it from the rest is the fact that somehow, all of the fake websites that are promoting this type of scam are using the same database for users [in other words, they're probably connected to one another]: Screenshot [there are a couple of duplicate pages (sorry )]Code:https://crypto2xbet.nethttps://cryptoxnade.comhttps://bitvix.orghttps://nicecryptobet.comhttps://nbet.co.inhttps://jackpotxcasino.comhttps://cryptoxjackpot.com

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on November 17, 2022, 08:56:00 PMQuote from: ScamViruS on November 17, 2022, 07:53:58 PMHis explanationQuoteok, I'll explain in brief, I found a vulnerability in the code on which this site is written, with which I can make any player a winner, I propose to make you a winner and divide the profit in half, https://ca777ino.uk/ go to the site and choose any player who is now betting, write me his nickname and I will make him the winner, thereby proving my veracity.Hahaha, what a lame explanation from him. If the gambling platform for legit, He would write to them about the exploit in exchange for a bounty. Also given the greedy nature of most human being, I doubt if he would share the exploit with any random stranger onlineThey give such poor explanations because the scammer may not know how a gambling website operates. They create a website and target members of various crypto related groups, send messages, and if some inexperienced crypto users fall into their trap, the scammers are successful. So they try to talk in a professional way but in reality they are also inexperienced.Quote from: SFR10 on November 20, 2022, 05:54:55 PMIt's been a while since I last saw this specific type of scam and the thing that separates it from the rest is the fact that somehow, all of the fake websites that are promoting this type of scam are using the same database for users [in other words, they're probably connected to one another]: Screenshot [there are a couple of duplicate pages (sorry )]All the websites have the same design, only the domain name changes. I came across similar websites a few years ago from Telegram scammers like this one. Nothing has changed from the previous website except the domain name.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: This is probably one of the oldest scams in the book and it is still working because people are dumb. Some random guy contacts you on TG or other social media platforms, saying that he works for the casino site or found a vulnerability and will make you a millionaire if you agree to share the spoils with him. Of course you have to deposit first. Same old bullshit story. You deposit your Bitcoins, and then you get nothing in return. This is a very common scam, especially on TG. Do not fall for it!

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on November 20, 2022, 08:34:37 PMThis is probably one of the oldest scams in the book and it is still working because people are dumb. Some random guy contacts you on TG or other social media platforms, saying that he works for the casino site or found a vulnerability and will make you a millionaire if you agree to share the spoils with him. Of course you have to deposit first. Same old bullshit story. You deposit your Bitcoins, and then you get nothing in return. This is a very common scam, especially on TG. Do not fall for it! They targeted new gamblers who are not aware of this scheme, this is indeed very old I remember asking about this here in Bitcointalk some three or four years ago, it's really this old, I just knew that scheme will be back because it works for users who are not aware on how these things work and if the potential victim is greedy he will likely fall to this scheme.Schemes to scam people are always recycled if they made money in the past, they will always have victims in the future that are not aware of this, so it's better to share this scheme with friends who are new to online casinos.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on November 20, 2022, 08:34:37 PMThis is probably one of the oldest scams in the book and it is still working because people are dumb. Some random guy contacts you on TG or other social media platforms, saying that he works for the casino site or found a vulnerability and will make you a millionaire if you agree to share the spoils with him. Of course you have to deposit first. Same old bullshit story. You deposit your Bitcoins, and then you get nothing in return. This is a very common scam, especially on TG. Do not fall for it! From creating the scam website, these scammers put a lot of effort into making the website accessible to crypto users. As new people are coming into the crypto market every day, their old tricks also look attractive to those new crypto users. As a result they keep sending random messages, they don't feel too shy even though they get abuse from old crypto users like us. Telegram is full of scammers now, you won't be wrong to think of yourself as a millionaire every day with the tempting offers you will get on Telegram. But until a crypto user sends money, the secret behind it is not understood.
